title._content: [Portrait of Chubby Jackson, Downbeat, New York, N.Y., ca. Nov. 1946] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Chubby Jackson, Downbeat, New York, N.Y., ca. Nov. 1946] 1 negative : b&w ; 3 1/4 x 4 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: Chubby took off from the Herman Herd to start his own quartet. He opened in New York on The Street but nothing happened, musically or commercially. So now Chubby is sans quartet but organizing a larger unit that he hopes to use for a concert tour. This shot was taken at the Down Beat Club. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 150 Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: The Record Changer, v. 5, no. 9 (Nov. 46, 1946), p. 12. Subjects: Jackson, Chubby Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Double bassists--1940-1950. Fifty-second Street (New York, N.Y.)--1940-1950. Downbeat Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.12521 Call Number: LC-GLB13- 1252
